page.title: 17DIALECT FOREST OF DEAN
page.content: Forest of Dean Dialect. A Word of Thanks by Mabel M.Beech. Joys Green School 'ave ztood 'ere fer just a 'unded years. Theze stwuns thoy 'ave echoed tu voices,-laughter-tears. Generations of children 'ave passed atween thic door, An'-we be a 'opin' thair'll be many many more. When them doors wuz vust opened,all them years agoo, T'were a diff'rent picture of children passin'druw. Thoy wuz all dressed in clothes like we 'ave never zin, An'education t'were a burden tu many az wen' in. Thoy used tu write,an'du thair zums,upon a zlate wi' chalk.Thoy didn't cum tu zchool in cars-No,thoy'ad tu walk!
